comment.text:
I cannot thank you enough for bringing Incus up to date.  You are my hero.

I was able to install it on a dirty Fedora 41, dirty as in I had 6.X installed and had gone through a number hacks and debugging trying to get it functional, followed up with my attempt to completely remove Incus, then I enabled the test repositories and 6.8 installed without any issues.  

Seem to recall the daemon didn't start on install, but again, my system isn't in the best shape.  I intend to install on a clean Fedora 41 and report back.

Again, much appreciation for bringing Incus up to date!!!

bugs.title: incus.service missing an environment variable INCUS_SOCKET

bugzilla.short_desc: incus.service missing an environment variable INCUS_SOCKET

long_desc.thetext:
See https://github.com/lxc/incus/pull/800

We need to add this line to incus.service 

    Environment=INCUS_SOCKET=/run/incus/unix.socket

in order for the pre-start hook to run.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. dnf install incus
2. set up uid mapping 
   echo "root:1000000:1000000000" >> /etc/subuid
   echo "root:1000000:1000000000" >> /etc/subgid
3. systemctl enable --now incus
4. set up storage for incus
5. incus launch images:fedora/40 vm01
Actual Results:  
Error: Failed to run: /usr/libexec/incus/incusd forkstart vm01 /var/lib/incus/containers /run/incus/vm01/lxc.conf: exit status 1
Try `incus info --show-log vm01` for more info

the container didn't start

Expected Results:  
No errors; container starts normally

bugs.title: [abrt] incus-client: runtime.raise(): incus killed by SIGABRT

bugzilla.short_desc: [abrt] incus-client: runtime.raise(): incus killed by SIGABRT

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
I click `incus` with tab key to invoke shell completion then it encountered crash.

Version-Release number of selected component:
incus-client-6.2-3.fc41

Additional info:
reporter:       libreport-2.17.15
type:           CCpp
reason:         incus killed by SIGABRT
journald_cursor: s=8a2b7c0424b545c491454e0015fc6e33;i=2530b9;b=a94f1656b4f74a32ae8ed2bbb345356a;m=22e4ea20c1;t=627c07fd9284f;x=47ef7bd48b76d1cb
executable:     /usr/bin/incus
cmdline:        incus __complete launch
cgroup:         0::/user.slice/user-1000.slice/user@1000.service/app.slice/app-org.gnome.Terminal.slice/vte-spawn-91d3780d-654a-421c-87da-93e60333adf0.scope
rootdir:        /
uid:            1000
kernel:         6.11.7-300.fc41.x86_64
package:        incus-client-6.2-3.fc41
runlevel:       N 5
comment:        I click `incus` with tab key to invoke shell completion then it encountered crash.
backtrace_rating: 4
crash_function: runtime.raise

bugs.title: CVE-2024-45337 incus: Misuse of ServerConfig.PublicKeyCallback may cause authorization bypass in golang.org/x/crypto [fedora-41]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-45337 incus: Misuse of ServerConfig.PublicKeyCallback may cause authorization bypass in golang.org/x/crypto [fedora-41]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-45337 golang.org/x/crypto/ssh: Misuse of ServerConfig.PublicKeyCallback may cause authorization bypass in golang.org/x/crypto

long_desc.thetext: Applications and libraries which misuse the ServerConfig.PublicKeyCallback callback may be susceptible to an authorization bypass.

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Advanced Cluster Management for Kubernetes 2.12 for RHEL 9

title: incus-6.8-1.fc41
